contentrichtext.text: {{otheruses}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} In [[Etruscan mythology]], '''Laran''' was the god of [[war]]. In art, he was portrayed as a [[nudity|naked]] young man with a [[helmet]] and a [[spear]]. Laran's consort was [[Turan (mythology)|Turan]] (who would later become [[Venus (mythology)|Venus]] under the Romans). Laran would go on to be merged with the Greek pantheon's [[Ares]] and his Etruscan companion [[Veive]] to form the Roman's god of war: [[Mars (mythology)|Mars]]. <!--Darkover novels "laran" psychic ability such as telepathy, telekinesis, clairvoyance etc.--> [[Category:Etruscan gods]] [[Category:Etruscan religion]] [[Category:War gods]] {{Etruria-stub}} {{deity-stub}}
